author: DanaKil
message:
Thank you for your work Aurélien, I often use KRuler and every improvement is a good news for me ! :)
Since there a some KRuler's users in this thread, maybe someone has some informations about this :
I'm pretty sure that in the KDE 3 days, one was able to drag-n-move the ruler outside of the screen. Since KDE 4, this is no more possible and this is sometimes inconvenient, especially when the ruler is long.

Can someone confirm this ? It seems like a regression to me but maybe I'm wrong and this has never been possible ?

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: This is a KWin "feature" (it does not happen with OpenBox). You can work around it by enabling "Native moving" in the advanced settings.

replies.author: DanaKil
replies.message: Wow thank you, not sure where this "native moving" option is located but I will take a look tomorrow :)

author: Syam Krishnan
message: Thank you! I use KRuler often for GUI design. Thanks for making it freely resize-able. I too have found the fixed sizes to be an inconvenience at times.

author: Parker Coates
message:
I always expected switching from "North" to "South" to swap the zero end of the ruler, but it didn't. Swapping the demarcated edge was a pretty useless feature and I think you made the right call to get rid of it, but I'd still like to see an option to swap the ends of the ruler.

I've run into a few scenarios where I need to make several measurements from the same "baseline" on the right hand side. Currently to do so I either have to move the ruler for each one or do subtractions in my head. Both options are slow, annoying and more error prone.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Good news: you can already do this :) Open the context menu and go to "Scale > Right to left".

author: Kevin Funk
message: KRuler <3 -- thanks for your work on that tool!

author: aiphee
message:
Well, it does look nice now, but i really miss color picker. As a web coder, i could have had a ruler on top, measure sizes and conveniently press ctrl + c to copy color to clipboard. Now, it is much more trouble to pick a color for me.

Couldn't the center of the ruler be transparent, where the shortcut would copy color inside?

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: I understand it is always annoying to change ones work-flow, but I believe you are better off using a separate tool to pick colors, there are a few existing tools which will do at least as good as what KRuler provided to pick colors.
